availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Varner (Caldwell & Warren Co, Kentucky petitioner)

body.p: Hamilton County, Tennessee, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Sabrina Elizabeth "Ibba" Moulton Varner. Father of William Moulton Varner, Harriett Jane Varner, Gilbert Varner, Peter Mack Varner, Ruthanna Varner, Barbara Arrena Varner, Noble W. Varner, and J. Baxter Varner. Married to Elizabeth Jones Verner in Rhea County, Tennessee, in May 1856. Farmer in Hamilton County, Tennessee, in 1850. Signed a petition on behalf of Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on January 22, 1861. Signed a petition on behalf of H. Grider in Warren County on May 19, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Hamilton County, District 27, p. 393A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Barry County, Sugar Creek, p. 749A.
Janice B. Palmer, Varner, Verner, Werner Families of America (Pensacola, FL: Kissing Cousins, 1995) 573.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Rhea Co, TN, 1808 Sep-1899 Jun: Marriages 1-2, p. 92.
